intro: Coniogramme taiwanensis, commonly known as the Taiwan coniogramme, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with a distinctive, palmately arranged structure. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture.
